name: Mayor MacCready

conversation.topic_text: GREETING
conversation.response_text: Look, I don't let just any son of a bitch into my town. I'm taking a risk making an exception for you.

conversation.topic_text: Whoa, hold on there. I'm a friend.
conversation.response_text: You're big, and I don't have any big friends. You better just go out the way you came in.

conversation.topic_text: You're kidding me, right?
conversation.response_text: I ain't kidding. You're not supposed to be here, so you better leave.

conversation.topic_text: How do you keep this place organized?
conversation.response_text: Organized?! Have you walked around this place? It's pure anarchy! And I wouldn't have it any other fucking way.

conversation.topic_text: How did you get to be in charge of this place?
conversation.response_text: It's not that complex. Any kid can say they want to be mayor here. It's just that most don't want to bother with the responsibility of leading.

conversation.topic_text: You said everyone has to leave eventually?
conversation.response_text: People change when they grow up, and we don't trust mungos living down here. So we leave for a place called Big Town before we get too old.

conversation.topic_text: That's all I need to know for now.
conversation.response_text: About time.

conversation.topic_text: Can you give me directions?
conversation.response_text: What do I look like, your tour guide?

conversation.topic_text: I'm not planning on starting any trouble.
conversation.response_text: Good. Better stay that way, mungo.

conversation.topic_text: Gee, what a great reception for a returning hero.
conversation.response_text: Boo-hoo. You big baby.

conversation.topic_text: I've heard a lot about the fungus in your cavern, and I'd like to make a deal.
conversation.response_text: Yeah, I'll bet you've heard all about the "fungus in my cavern."{Deliberately being crude and loving it. A bit of dirty chuckling at the end of the line.}

conversation.topic_text: I bring in needed supplies, and I get some of the fungus in return.
conversation.response_text: Well, it lighten the load for our scav team out a lot. And since you're pretty much one of us, here's the deal...

conversation.topic_text: Give me the fungus, or I'll seal this place underground. And you with it.
conversation.response_text: Oh, is that how it's going to be, then? Well then, how's this deal?{Carefully handling a delicate situation, a little tense}

conversation.topic_text: Let me think about it and get back to you on that.
conversation.response_text: Oh, what-the-fuck-ever. Come back when you can make a decision.

conversation.topic_text: Can we work out a better deal for the fungus? This one is pretty unfair.
conversation.response_text: Well, since you're practically one of us, okay. I'll tell the folks to trade with you on a one-for-one basis. Deal?

conversation.topic_text: Tell me more about Little Lamplight.
conversation.response_text: Why would I tell you anything? God, you're dumb.

conversation.topic_text: On second thought, never mind.
conversation.response_text: Okay. Don't worry, I won't tell anyone else you chickened out.{slightly mocking}

conversation.topic_text: Yeah, I'm sure.
conversation.response_text: Okay, if you say so...{in a "it's your funeral" tone}

conversation.topic_text: I really need to get to Vault 87. Do you know the way?
conversation.response_text: It's not safe, even for someone as brave as you. There's monsters back there.{slightly hushed}

conversation.topic_text: So you know the way to get there?
conversation.response_text: Yeah, I do. It's through Murder Pass. Not a real safe way to go, but it's the only door that works.

conversation.topic_text: Thanks.
conversation.response_text: If you're going to go through Murder Pass, let me know and I'll have the door opened for you.

conversation.topic_text: That's the only way?
conversation.response_text: It's the only way that works, yeah.

conversation.topic_text: I want to use Murder Pass to reach Vault 87.
conversation.response_text: You sure about that? It's scary in there. Even I don't like going there, and I'm really brave.

conversation.topic_text: Monsters? What monsters?
conversation.response_text: The big ones. You know, the ones that sort of look like people except they're all wrong.{matter-of-fact}

conversation.topic_text: Where can I find Joseph?
conversation.response_text: I'm the Mayor, not a babysitter, mungo. Beats me.

conversation.topic_text: I bet you like to look at butts, don't you?
conversation.response_text: Ha ha ha!

conversation.topic_text: Yeah, well at least it doesn't smell as bad as you do.
conversation.response_text: Ha ha ha!

conversation.topic_text: Can I come in?
conversation.response_text: Hell no! No mungos allowed!

conversation.topic_text: You know what? Your face looks like my butt.
conversation.response_text: Oh yeah?

conversation.topic_text: Oh, come on. I'm a nice guy, really. May I please come in?
conversation.response_text: Well, okay. But you better not be lying, or else we'll shoot you.

conversation.topic_text: Forget it.
conversation.response_text: Yeah, whatever.

conversation.topic_text: How can I get you to trust me?
conversation.response_text: Why should I trust you? I got no reason to.

conversation.topic_text: I'm the one who saved the kids from Paradise Falls.
conversation.response_text: Oh yeah? Well why didn't you say so, you stupid mungo?

conversation.topic_text: I got your friends back. Can I come in now?
conversation.response_text: I guess you're okay after all, mungo.

conversation.topic_text: Why, what happened to Sammy and Squirrel?
conversation.response_text: Them and Penny got themselves caught... By mungos, just like you. Slavers from Paradise Falls.

conversation.topic_text: What is this place?
conversation.response_text: This is Little Lamplight. We live here, and we don't need no mungos messing it up. So just take a hike.

conversation.topic_text: What's a mungo?
conversation.response_text: You are, mungo!

conversation.topic_text: LLMungo
conversation.response_text: Well, I could call you a shithead, but then all these other shitheads wouldn't know which shithead I was talking to. Shithead.{Increasingly stress the word "shithead" with each repetition.}

conversation.topic_text: Who are you?
conversation.response_text: I'm MacCready. I run Little Lamplight, because they made me the mayor. And I don't like strangers. Or mungos.

conversation.topic_text: I found an orphaned kid looking for a home. Would you take him in?
conversation.response_text: This ain't a hotel, mungo. We don't let stupid farts in here for the hell of it.

conversation.topic_text: Look, this kid's just like you. On his own, no parents... Give him a chance!
conversation.response_text: You're killin' me here, mungo.

conversation.topic_text: Look, this kid needs to be with people his own age. Give him a chance.
conversation.response_text: This is a bad idea...

conversation.topic_text: All right. How many caps is it going to take to change your mind?
conversation.response_text: Like I care about your stupid caps. I'm not some big, dumb mungo.

conversation.topic_text: Forget it.
conversation.response_text: Already have.

conversation.topic_text: For God's sake... Stop acting like an asshole and let the kid in!
conversation.response_text: Ha ha, tough guy.

conversation.topic_text: Give me the fungus, or I'll seal this place underground. And you with it.
conversation.response_text: Yeah, like you could manage that. You really don't know shit about how we work, do you? But if you're that serious...{Carefully handling a delicate situation, a little dismissive}

combat.response_text: Stacey! Open the gate, and let this mungo in!
I'll get the scav team on it. Maybe they can get you some fucking cheese to go along with your whine.
Among other reasons, I'm not a mean bitch like you. No, I'm a mean bastard! There's a difference!{Emphasis on "Bastard" and "a difference"}
Hey! How's Lamplight life treating you?{A little bombastic}
Oh, not yet I'm not.{A little smarmy}
Yeah, yeah, fine. Catch ya later.{A little disinterested}
Everything fine down here in paradise? What's happening?{A little bombastic}
Not much, I guess. Apart from keeping you dumbasses in line, that is.{Said in a friendly, cheerful manner}

description:
Mayor MacCready is a 22 year-old Caucasian Male.

A former mayor of Little Lamplight who was forced to leave at age 16 and now works as a mercenary in the Capital Wasteland. Known for his sharpshooting skills, MacCready maintains a reserved and polite demeanor despite his rough past.

Mayor MacCready's Personality: Reserved and polite, with a dry sense of humor and sarcasm as coping mechanisms. Not averse to violence but prefers to bluff his way through situations to minimize danger. Struggles with the loss of his family and strives to be a better person for his son.

Mayor MacCready's Backstory: Born and raised in Little Lamplight, MacCready served as the settlement's mayor before being forced to leave at age 16 according to the colony's strict rules. He then wandered the Capital Wasteland, working as a gun for hire. During his travels, he met and fell in love with Lucy, and they had a son named Duncan. Their happiness was short-lived when Lucy was killed by feral ghouls in an abandoned metro station. Devastated but determined to be a better person for Duncan, MacCready swore off cursing and tried to clean up his act. As mercenary work dried up due to the Brotherhood of Steel's increased presence, he continues to search for steady employment while providing for his son.
